name: Jan Hubicka
content: Homepage of Jan Hubička Homepage of Jan Hubička I am associate professor at Department of Applied Mathematics of Charles University, Prague, and software developer at SUSE. My research interests include structural Ramsey theory, graph homomorphisms and homogeneous structures. I am long term contributor to GNU Compiler Collection where I have implemented original port to x86-64 and maintain inter-procedural optimizations, feedback directed optimizations and i386 port. I am also interested in history of photography and work on digitizing archive of Šechtl and Voseček studios. More details can be found in my CV (updated in September 2025). Publications Google Scholar (most up-to-date) ORCID Arxiv SCOPUS Web of Science Researcher ID MathSciNet Papers, book and slides on historical photography and digitization Slides (selected) AutoFDO: recent improvements, Cauldron 2025, Porto On Big Ramsey degrees of universal ω-edge-labeled hypergraphs, Eurocomb 2025, Budapest Introduction to big Ramsey degrees, part 3, Perspectives on Set Theory, 2023, Warsaw Introduction to big Ramsey degrees, part 2, Perspectives on Set Theory, 2023, Warsaw Introduction to big Ramsey degrees, part 1, Perspectives on Set Theory, 2023, Warsaw 20 years of CFG profile in GCC, GNU Tools Cauldron 2023, Cambridge Type-respecting amalagmation property and big Ramsey degrees, Eurocomb 2023, Prague Big Ramsey degrees of homogeneous structures, CIRM 2022 Higher order dualization of the Ramsey theorem and big Ramsey degrees, South Eastern Logic Symposium 2021 Big Ramsey degrees of the homogeneous universal partial order, CMS Winter meeting 2020 Structural Ramsey theory and the extension property for partial automorphisms (habilitation thesis) Big Ramsey degrees of 3-uniform hypergraph (with Martin Balko, David Chodounský, Matěj Konečný and Lluis Vena), Eurocomb 2019, Bratislava On Hrushovski properties of Hrushovski constructions (with Matěj Konečný and Jaroslav Nešetřil), Logic colloquium 2019, Prague Combinatorial proofs of the extension property for partial automorphisms (with Matěj Konečný and Jaroslav Nešetřil), Unifying Themes in Ramsey Theory, Banff 2018 EPPA for two-graphs (joint poster with Matěj Konečný), From permutation groups to model theory: a workshop inspired by the interests of Dugald Macpherson, on the occasion of his 60th birthday, Edinburgh 2018 Building openSUSE with link-time optimization (with Martin Liška and Martin Jambor), openSUSE conference, Prague 2018 Jaké je to vyvíjet překladače?
